sentences.sentence: UNIDO together with the European Union and the Government of Sindh launched PAIDAR programme to contribute to sustainable poverty reduction and improve the livelihoods of rural communities across Sindh province Karachi (18 May 2022), The United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) launched the Poverty Alleviation and Inclusive Development Across Rural Sindh (PAIDAR) funded by the European Union (EU) and to support the Government of Sindh (GoS) in the implementation of its Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS).

The launch event was attended by Mr. Faisal Ahmed Uqaili, Secretary Planning & Development, Mr. Ovidiu Mic - Head of Cooperation, Delegation of the European Union to Pakistan, Mr. Julien Harneis - United Nations Resident Coordinator, Pakistan, Ms. Nadia Aftab - UNIDO Country Representative, Mr. Stephen Langrell -Team Leader, Rural Development & Economic Cooperation, Delegation of the European Union to Pakistan, Mr. Steffen Kaeser, Unit Chief UNIDO HQ, and Mr. G. Mohiuddin Asim - Director General, Directorate of Urban Regional Policy & Strategic Planning, along with representation from the public and private sectors.

Opening the session, Ms. Nadia Aftab, UNIDO Country Representative, introduced the PAIDAR programme, and its objectives and emphasized the importance of inter-agency collaboration to address the challenges of poverty reduction and economic development.

Mr. Faisal Ahmed Uqaili, Secretary Planning and Development remarked that PAIDAR is an important programme and is expected to play a critical role in meeting the objectives of the Sindh Poverty Reduction Strategy.
The EUD Head of Cooperation, Mr. Ovidiu Mic said that Pakistan is an important country for the EU.
The EUD is pleased to finance the PAIDAR programme to help GoS resolve poverty across rural areas of Sindh at the grass-root levels.
Speaking to the audience, Mr. Julien Harneis, UN Resident Coordinator for Pakistan shared the importance of inclusivity particularly women in sustainable poverty reduction, and that

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.

text: UNIDO together with the European Union and the Government of Sindh launched PAIDAR programme to contribute to sustainable poverty reduction and improve the livelihoods of rural communities across Sindh province Karachi (18 May 2022), The United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) launched the Poverty Alleviation and Inclusive Development Across Rural Sindh (PAIDAR) funded by the European Union (EU) and to support the Government of Sindh (GoS) in the implementation of its Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS). The launch event was attended by Mr. Faisal Ahmed Uqaili, Secretary Planning & Development, Mr. Ovidiu Mic - Head of Cooperation, Delegation of the European Union to Pakistan, Mr. Julien Harneis - United Nations Resident Coordinator, Pakistan, Ms. Nadia Aftab - UNIDO Country Representative, Mr. Stephen Langrell -Team Leader, Rural Development & Economic Cooperation, Delegation of the European Union to Pakistan, Mr. Steffen Kaeser, Unit Chief UNIDO HQ, and Mr. G. Mohiuddin Asim - Director General, Directorate of Urban Regional Policy & Strategic Planning, along with representation from the public and private sectors. Opening the session, Ms. Nadia Aftab, UNIDO Country Representative, introduced the PAIDAR programme, and its objectives and emphasized the importance of inter-agency collaboration to address the challenges of poverty reduction and economic development. Mr. Faisal Ahmed Uqaili, Secretary Planning and Development remarked that PAIDAR is an important programme and is expected to play a critical role in meeting the objectives of the Sindh Poverty Reduction Strategy. The EUD Head of Cooperation, Mr. Ovidiu Mic said that Pakistan is an important country for the EU. The EUD is pleased to finance the PAIDAR programme to help GoS resolve poverty across rural areas of Sindh at the grass-root levels. Speaking to the audience, Mr. Julien Harneis, UN Resident Coordinator for Pakistan shared the importance of inclusivity particularly women in sustainable poverty reduction, and that
